remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve been experiencing severe low back pain along with weakness in both of your lower extremities, more pronounced on the left side. Can you tell me more about how these symptoms have affected your ability to walk or perform daily activities?

remedi_labels.value: weakness in both lower extremities, more pronounced on the left side
how symptoms have affected ability to walk or perform daily activities

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, yeah... it’s mostly the severe low back pain that’s really bothering me. It’s gotten pretty bad, and I’m just worried because it makes it hard to move around or do much at home. I’m not sure if this is something serious, but it’s definitely affecting me a lot.

remedi_labels.value: hard to move around or do much at home
not sure if this is something serious

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about these symptoms, especially since the pain is severe and affecting your daily life. In addition to the low back pain, you mentioned weakness in both lower extremities, more on the left—can you describe if you’ve noticed any numbness, tingling, or changes in sensation in your legs as well?

remedi_labels.value: pain is severe and affecting daily life
low back pain, weakness in both lower extremities, more on the left
numbness, tingling, or changes in sensation in legs

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um... the main thing I’ve noticed is just how weak my legs feel, especially on the left. I don’t really know about numbness or tingling, but it’s hard to trust my legs sometimes. And actually, I’ve also been having this chronic shortness of breath, which is making me even more anxious. Should I be worried?

I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious, especially with both the weakness in your legs and the ongoing shortness of breath. To help guide our assessment, can you tell me if you’ve experienced any weakness or numbness in your left shoulder as well, or if those symptoms have changed recently?

remedi_labels.value: weakness or numbness in left shoulder

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Oh, um... actually, yes, my left shoulder has felt pretty weak lately, and there’s some numbness there too. It’s not something I noticed right away, but it’s been getting worse. And about the shortness of breath—I’ve had episodes where my oxygen saturation dropped into the mid 80s when I was just on room air. It got a little better with the nasal cannula, up to the low 90s, but then even on 6 liters it went back down to the mid 80s until they put me on a nonrebreather. That really scared me. Is this normal with what’s going on?

remedi_labels.value: oxygen saturation dropped into the mid 80s on room air
oxygen saturation increased to low 90s with nasal cannula
oxygen saturation went back down to mid 80s on 6 liters
Is this normal with what’s going on?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d feel anxious, especially with both the worsening weakness and numbness in your left shoulder and the episodes of significant shortness of breath. To help with our assessment, have you noticed any changes in your bladder or bowel function, such as difficulty controlling urination or new constipation, since these neurological symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: worsening weakness and numbness in left shoulder
changes in bladder or bowel function such as difficulty controlling urination or new constipation

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, let me think... I haven’t really noticed any big changes with my bladder or bowels. No trouble controlling urination or anything like that. Mostly it’s just the weakness in both legs—especially the left—and now the left shoulder feeling weak and numb. I guess I’m just worried because it all seems to be getting worse, and then with the shortness of breath on top of it, it’s a lot to handle.

remedi_labels.value: no changes with bladder or bowels
left shoulder feeling weak and numb

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with your symptoms getting worse and affecting multiple areas. To help guide our assessment, have you experienced any changes in your ability to feel temperature or touch in your legs or left shoulder, or noticed any areas of numbness spreading since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with your symptoms getting worse and affecting multiple areas.
changes in ability to feel temperature or touch in legs or left shoulder
areas of numbness spreading since symptoms began

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Um, well... I think my left shoulder definitely feels more numb than it used to, like I can’t really feel touch or temperature there as well. My legs, I’m not totally sure—it’s mostly just the weakness, but maybe a little bit of numbness too, especially on the left. 

Actually, now that I think about it, I’ve also had a decreased appetite lately, and just a minimal cough—not much, but it’s there. I’m just feeling pretty anxious with all these symptoms adding up.

remedi_labels.value: reduced sensation to touch or temperature in left shoulder

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be anxious with these symptoms affecting your strength, sensation, and overall well-being. To help with our assessment, have you experienced any difficulty with coordination or balance, such as unsteady walking or frequent falls, since the onset of your bilateral lower extremity weakness and left shoulder numbness?

remedi_labels.value: difficulty with coordination or balance, unsteady walking, frequent falls
symptoms affecting strength, sensation, and overall well-being

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually, now that you mention it, I have had some trouble with balance. I feel kind of unsteady when I walk, and there have been a couple times where I almost lost my balance—no big falls yet, but it worries me. The weakness in my legs and the numbness in my left shoulder just make me feel off.

Also, I wanted to ask about something else—they found a left upper lobe nodule on my scan, and I’ve been having these episodes of desaturation, where my oxygen levels drop pretty low. Is that related to everything else that’s going on? Should I be more concerned about the nodule or the desaturation?

remedi_labels.value: left upper lobe nodule on scan
Is the nodule or desaturation related to everything else?
Should I be more concerned about the nodule or the desaturation?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with the combination of weakness, numbness, and episodes of low oxygen saturation. Given your symptoms of bilateral lower extremity weakness and left shoulder involvement, have you noticed any changes in your ability to perform fine motor tasks with your hands, such as buttoning clothes or writing, which could suggest further neurological involvement?

remedi_labels.value: changes in ability to perform fine motor tasks with hands (e.g., buttoning clothes, writing)

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Let me think… Actually, I haven’t really noticed any big symptoms with fine motor tasks like buttoning my clothes or writing—my hands seem okay for now. It’s mostly just the weakness and numbness in my left shoulder and both legs that’s making symptoms hard.

But I am really anxious because of all these symptoms, and especially the hypoxia episodes. My oxygen saturation has dropped pretty low at times, and I know that’s not good. Plus, they told me my white blood cell count is really low—something like 0.3—and I’m neutropenic. Should I be more worried about infections with that? And is all of this connected somehow?

remedi_labels.value: weakness in left shoulder and both legs
numbness in left shoulder and both legs
Should I be more worried about infections with that?
Is all of this connected somehow?
